intro: Selago pulchella, commonly known as the silverleaf lantana, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that range in color from white to purple. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. Selago pulchella is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
